metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: CSS Masking
With CSS masking you create a mask layer to place over an element to partially or fully hide portions of the element.
content.html: With CSS masking you create a mask layer to place over an element to partially or fully hide portions of the element.

content.text: The CSS mask-image Property
The CSS mask-image property specifies a mask layer image.
content.html: The CSS mask-image property specifies a mask layer image.

content.text: The mask layer image can be a PNG image, an SVG image, a CSS gradient , or an SVG <mask> element .
content.html: The mask layer image can be a PNG image, an SVG image, a CSS gradient, or an SVG <mask> element.

content.text: Browser Support
The numbers in the table below specify the first browser version that fully supports the property.
content.html: The numbers in the table below specify the first browser version that fully supports the property.

content.text: Numbers followed by -webkit- specify the first version that worked with a prefix.
content.html: Numbers followed by -webkit- specify the first version that worked with a prefix.

content.code_html:
Property
mask-image 120 120 53 15.4 15 -webkit-

content.text: Use an Image as the Mask Layer
To use a PNG or an SVG image as the mask layer, use a url() value to pass in the mask layer image.
content.html: To use a PNG or an SVG image as the mask layer, use a url() value to pass in the mask layer image.

content.text: The mask image needs to have a transparent or semi-transparent area. Black indicates fully transparent.
content.html: The mask image needs to have a transparent or semi-transparent area. Black indicates fully transparent.

content.text: Here is the mask image (a PNG image) we will use:
content.html: Here is the mask image (a PNG image) we will use:

content.text: Here is an image from Cinque Terre, in Italy:
content.html: Here is an image from Cinque Terre, in Italy:

content.text: Now, we apply the mask image (the PNG image above) as the mask layer for the image from Cinque Terre, Italy:
content.html: Now, we apply the mask image (the PNG image above) as the mask layer for the image from Cinque Terre, Italy:

content.code_html:
.mask1 {
  -webkit-mask-image: url(w3logo.png);
  mask-image: url(w3logo.png);
  mask-repeat: no-repeat;
}

content.text: Example Explained
The mask-image property specifies the image to be used as a mask layer for an element.
content.html: The mask-image property specifies the image to be used as a mask layer for an element.

content.text: The mask-repeat property specifies if or how a mask image will be repeated. The no-repeat value indicates that the mask image will not be repeated (the mask image will only be shown once).
content.html: The mask-repeat property specifies if or how a mask image will be repeated. The no-repeat value indicates that the mask image will not be repeated (the mask image will only be shown once).

content.text: Another Example
If we omit the mask-repeat property, the mask image will be repeated all over the image from Cinque Terre, Italy:
content.html: If we omit the mask-repeat property, the mask image will be repeated all over the image from Cinque Terre, Italy:

content.code_html:
.mask1 {
  -webkit-mask-image: url(w3logo.png);
  mask-image: url(w3logo.png);
}

content.text: Use Gradients as the Mask Layer
CSS linear and radial gradients can also be used as mask images.
content.html: CSS linear and radial gradients can also be used as mask images.

content.text: Linear Gradient Examples
Here, we use a linear-gradient as the mask layer for our image. This linear gradient goes from top (black) to bottom (transparent):
content.html: Here, we use a linear-gradient as the mask layer for our image. This linear gradient goes from top (black) to bottom (transparent):

content.code_html:
.mask1 {
  -webkit-mask-image: linear-gradient(black, transparent);
  mask-image: linear-gradient(black, transparent);
}

content.text: Here, we use a linear-gradient along with text masking as the mask layer for our image:
content.html: Here, we use a linear-gradient along with text masking as the mask layer for our image:

content.text: The Cinque Terre is a coastal area within Liguria, in the northwest of Italy. It lies in the west of La Spezia Province, and comprises five villages: Monterosso al Mare, Vernazza, Corniglia, Manarola, and Riomaggiore.
content.html: The Cinque Terre is a coastal area within Liguria, in the northwest of Italy. It lies in the west of La Spezia Province, and comprises five villages: Monterosso al Mare, Vernazza, Corniglia, Manarola, and Riomaggiore.

content.text: The Cinque Terre is a coastal area within Liguria, in the northwest of Italy. It lies in the west of La Spezia Province, and comprises five villages: Monterosso al Mare, Vernazza, Corniglia, Manarola, and Riomaggiore.
content.html: The Cinque Terre is a coastal area within Liguria, in the northwest of Italy. It lies in the west of La Spezia Province, and comprises five villages: Monterosso al Mare, Vernazza, Corniglia, Manarola, and Riomaggiore.

content.text: The Cinque Terre is a coastal area within Liguria, in the northwest of Italy. It lies in the west of La Spezia Province, and comprises five villages: Monterosso al Mare, Vernazza, Corniglia, Manarola, and Riomaggiore.
content.html: The Cinque Terre is a coastal area within Liguria, in the northwest of Italy. It lies in the west of La Spezia Province, and comprises five villages: Monterosso al Mare, Vernazza, Corniglia, Manarola, and Riomaggiore.

content.code_html:
.mask1 {
  max-width: 600px;
  height: 350px;
  overflow-y: scroll;
  background: url(img_5terre.jpg) no-repeat;
  -webkit-mask-image: linear-gradient(black, transparent);
  mask-image: linear-gradient (black, transparent);
}

content.text: Radial Gradient Examples
Here, we use a radial-gradient (shaped as a circle) as the mask layer for our image:
content.html: Here, we use a radial-gradient (shaped as a circle) as the mask layer for our image:

content.code_html:
.mask2 {
  -webkit-mask-image: radial-gradient(circle, black 50%, rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5) 50%);
  mask-image: radial-gradient(circle, black 50%, rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5) 50%);
}

content.text: Here, we use a radial-gradient (shaped as an ellipse) as the mask layer for our image:
content.html: Here, we use a radial-gradient (shaped as an ellipse) as the mask layer for our image:

content.code_html:
.mask3 {
  -webkit-mask-image: radial-gradient(ellipse, black 50%, rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5) 50%);
  mask-image: radial-gradient(ellipse, black 50%, rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5) 50%);
}

content.text: Use SVG as the Mask Layer
The SVG <mask> element can be used inside an SVG graphic to create masking effects.
content.html: The SVG <mask> element can be used inside an SVG graphic to create masking effects.

content.text: Here, we use the SVG <mask> element to create different mask layers for our image:
content.html: Here, we use the SVG <mask> element to create different mask layers for our image:

content.code:
<svg width="600" height="400">
  <mask id="svgmask1">
    
<polygon fill="#ffffff" points="200 0, 400 400, 0 400"></polygon>
  
</mask>
  <image xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" 
xlink:href="img_5terre.jpg" mask="url(#svgmask1)"></image>
</svg>
content.code_html:
<svg width="600" height="400">
  <mask id="svgmask1">
    <polygon fill="#ffffff" points="200 0, 400 400, 0 400"></polygon>
  </mask>
  <image xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="img_5terre.jpg" mask="url(#svgmask1)"></image>
</svg>

content.code:
<svg width="600" height="400">
  <mask id="svgmask2">
    
<polygon fill="#ffffff" points="100,10 40,198 190,78 10,78 
160,198"></polygon>
  </mask>
  <image xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" 
xlink:href="img_5terre.jpg" mask="url(#svgmask2)"></image>

</svg>
content.code_html:
<svg width="600" height="400">
  <mask id="svgmask2">
    <polygon fill="#ffffff" points="100,10 40,198 190,78 10,78 160,198"></polygon>
  </mask>
  <image xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="img_5terre.jpg" mask="url(#svgmask2)"></image>
</svg>

content.code:
<svg width="600" height="400">
  <mask 
id="svgmask3">
    <circle fill="#ffffff" cx="75" cy="75" 
r="75"></circle>
    <circle fill="#ffffff" cx="80" 
cy="260" r="75"></circle>
    <circle fill="#ffffff" 
cx="270" cy="160" r="75"></circle>
  </mask>
  <image 
xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="img_5terre.jpg"
mask="url(#svgmask3)"></image>
</svg>
content.code_html:
<svg width="600" height="400">
  <mask id="svgmask3">
    <circle fill="#ffffff" cx="75" cy="75" r="75"></circle>
    <circle fill="#ffffff" cx="80" cy="260" r="75"></circle>
    <circle fill="#ffffff" cx="270" cy="160" r="75"></circle>
  </mask>
  <image xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="img_5terre.jpg" mask="url(#svgmask3)"></image>
</svg>

content.question: Which of the following can be used as a mask layer in CSS?

content.text: CSS Masking Properties
The following table lists all the CSS masking properties:
content.html: The following table lists all the CSS masking properties:

content.code_html:
Property Description
mask-clip Specifies which area is affected by a mask image
mask-composite Specifies a compositing operation used on the current mask layer with the mask layers below it
mask-image Specifies an image to be used as a mask layer for an element
mask-mode Specifies whether the mask layer image is treated as a luminance mask or as an alpha mask
mask-origin Specifies the origin position (the mask position area) of a mask layer image
mask-position Sets the starting position of a mask layer image (relative to the mask position area)
mask-repeat Specifies how the mask layer image is repeated
mask-size Specifies the size of a mask layer image
